revised_title: Investigation of Long-Period Inequalities in the Motions of Earth and Venus
tldr: This paper investigates an inequality in the long-term motions of Earth and Venus, which arises from the gravitational interaction between the two planets. The author, William Whewell, and John William Lubbock analyze the complex calculations required to determine the magnitude and period of this inequality, drawing comparisons to previous investigations of similar phenomena in the planetary system.
